    • Method Detail

      • newDisk

        public void newDisk(java.lang.String args)
             throws UsageException
        create a new disk and use it as current working disk
        Parameters:
        args - user input argument String
        Throws:
        UsageException - thrown when 1) argument is not an Integer 2) argument count does not match
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when try to construct a disk less than 40 bytes

      • newDir

        public void newDir(java.lang.String args)
            throws UsageException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   MemoryException
        Add a new Directory in the current working directory
        Parameters:
        args - user input argument String
        Throws:
        UsageException - thrown when argument count does not match
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when 1)name of the directory is not legal 2)there's already a file named name in current working directory
        MemoryException - thrwon when disk does not have enough memory to accpet a new directory

      • newDoc

        public void newDoc(java.lang.String args)
            throws UsageException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   MemoryException
        Add a new Document in the current working directory
        Parameters:
        args - user input argument String content should be surrouded with double quotes eg.newDoc testDoc txt "Content in testDoc"
        Throws:
        UsageException - thrown when argument count does not match
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when 1)name of the document is not legal 2)there's already a file named name in current working directory
        MemoryException - thrwon when disk does not have enough memory to this new document

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String args)
            throws UsageException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        delete a file in current working directory
        Parameters:
        args - user input argument String
        Throws:
        UsageException - thrown when argument count does not match
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when 1)no such file in current working directory 2)"." or ".." is passed

      • rename

        public void rename(java.lang.String args)
            throws UsageException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        rename a file in current working directory
        Parameters:
        args - user input argument String
        Throws:
        UsageException - thrown when argument count does not match
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when 1)the file does not exist 2)the new name already exists 3)new name is not a valid name 4)try to rename '.' or '..'

      • store

        public void store(java.lang.String args)
           throws UsageException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Store the current Disk to Local File System Only support Windows System
        Parameters:
        args - User input argument String. A directory path is expected, where the files shall be stored
        Throws:
        UsageException - thrown when argument count does not match
        java.io.IOException - thrown when unexpected IO operation occurs

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String args)
          throws UsageException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Load from local file System to Comp Vitural File System Only support Windows System
        Parameters:
        args - User input argument String. A path name is expected.
        Throws:
        UsageException - thrown when argument count does not match
        java.io.IOException - thrown when unexpected IO operation occurs

      • undo

        public void undo(java.lang.String args)
          throws UsageException
        Undo the last command Currently only support undo for "newDir", "newDoc" and "rename"
        Parameters:
        args - User input argument String. An empty String is exptected
        Throws:
        UsageException - thrown when argument count does not match

      • redo

        public void redo(java.lang.String args)
          throws UsageException,
                 MemoryException
        redo the last undo command
        Parameters:
        args - User input argument String. An empty String is exptected
        Throws:
        UsageException - thrown when argument count does not match
        MemoryException - thrown when the operation cannot perform normally
